channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Key moments from Harris' extended TV interview. And, Trump voices support for IVF
item.description: Vice President Harris gave her first interview since entering the presidential race. Here's what she had to say. And, former President Donald Trump voices support for reproductive rights.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris gave her first interview since entering the presidential race. Here's what she had to say. And, former President Donald Trump voices support for reproductive rights.

(Image credit: Will Lanzoni)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: A Hong Kong court convicts 2 journalists in a landmark sedition case
item.description: The editors had pleaded not guilty to conspiracy to publish and reproduce seditious publications. They face up to two years in prison and a fine. They were given bail pending sentencing on Sept. 26.
item.content:encoded:
The editors had pleaded not guilty to conspiracy to publish and reproduce seditious publications. They face up to two years in prison and a fine. They were given bail pending sentencing on Sept. 26.

(Image credit: Louise Delmotte)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Hear here! Our list of the best podcasts by fourth graders
item.description: For the first time ever, NPR presents the fourth grade winners of the Student Podcast Challenge.
item.content:encoded: For the first time ever, NPR presents the fourth grade winners of the Student Podcast Challenge.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Migaki

item.title: These Oregon ranchers say the losses from summer range fires will be huge
item.description: More than a million acres of rangeland have burned in Oregon this summer. At times the wildfires barely made headlines, but ranchers say the economic fallout will be huge.
item.content:encoded:
More than a million acres of rangeland have burned in Oregon this summer. At times the wildfires barely made headlines, but ranchers say the economic fallout will be huge.

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: A newly mapped underwater mountain could be home to 20 new species
item.description: Researchers who led the 28-day expedition along the nearly 2-mile tall seamount hope the discoveries made will inform future policies safeguarding the understudied, high-seas region.
item.content:encoded:
Researchers who led the 28-day expedition along the nearly 2-mile tall seamount hope the discoveries made will inform future policies safeguarding the understudied, high-seas region.

(Image credit: ROV SuBastian/Schmidt Ocean Institute)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: This week's quiz is very demure, very _______. Can you fill in the blank?
item.description: This week, we have two middle-aged men who are not Tim Walz and JD Vance sniping at each other. Plus: drugs, Tolkien, sports and novelty beverages! Have fun.
item.content:encoded: This week, we have two middle-aged men who are not Tim Walz and JD Vance sniping at each other. Plus: drugs, Tolkien, sports and novelty beverages! Have fun.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: The GOP is making false claims about noncitizens voting. It’s affecting real voters
item.description: As the election nears, false rhetoric about noncitizen voting is having a real impact as some GOP officials are scrutinizing voter rolls and questioning some voters’ registrations.
item.content:encoded:
As the election nears, false rhetoric about noncitizen voting is having a real impact as some GOP officials are scrutinizing voter rolls and questioning some voters’ registrations.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Mosquito-borne illnesses are rising: Here's how to protect yourself
item.description: Mosquitos love heat. And as summers get warmer, mosquito-borne illnesses are rising, in the U.S., Europe, and South and Central America. Here are some tips to protect yourself.
item.content:encoded:
Mosquitos love heat. And as summers get warmer, mosquito-borne illnesses are rising, in the U.S., Europe, and South and Central America. Here are some tips to protect yourself.

(Image credit: Cavan Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: 6 takeaways from Harris' interview on CNN
item.description: Vice President Harris gave her first interview since jumping into the presidential race just a little over a month ago. Here's what we learned.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris gave her first interview since jumping into the presidential race just a little over a month ago. Here's what we learned.

(Image credit: Will Lanzoni)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: How AI-generated memes are changing the 2024 election
item.description: Donald Trump has repeatedly shared AI-generated content on social media in the latest example of how artificial intelligence is showing up in the 2024 election.
item.content:encoded:
Donald Trump has repeatedly shared AI-generated content on social media in the latest example of how artificial intelligence is showing up in the 2024 election.

(Image credit: @TRUMP_ARMY/screenshot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond
